positive.review: Addicting game with lots of replayability!

Game is well polished from a technical perspective, the gameplay is fantastic for casuals, but if you are good at the game, competitive/ranked play quickly devolves into pure RNG. The way matchmaking works, you can have a build that beats 99% of boards played by people of your same rank, and it will still frequently match you versus a board that shouldn't even exist. The devs are utterly clueless when it comes to balancing and ranked gameplay, and "bad luck prevention" mechanics are relatively lacking.

Again, it's a great game when you're a noob, and the game becomes drastically less fun when you're a top 1% player due to the over-reliance on RNG. Optimizing your board (min-maxing) should be rewarded, but the fights are instead determined by who happened to roll into the flavor of the month overpowered build, exacerbated by the devs' incompetence around balancing.

Its fun to rotate boxes and fit the items into stars, squares, triangles.

P.S i got no math skills.
Fun and lighthearted game with loads of replayability and many ways to play, good for both a relaxed time or a brain-intensive puzzle experience. Going to be a mainstay in my library for a while.

if you want some in depth deep story rich game this is  probably not the game for you but if you`ve got 10-15 mins to spare and you want something instant that leaves a smile on your face this will probably fit

Deceptively simple, but incredibly deep. Addictive item combinations and class-specific strategies make this a must-buy. The devs are highly responsive, adding quality-of-life features like Undo/Redo for easy inventory management. Definitely recommend!

Great game for relaxing moments!
I wish I could also play it on my MacBook....I hope the Devs can find a solution for that. :)

Otherwise a 10/10 game, you get what you see! <3
This is fun, I had fun. nothing more to say, give it a try and see for yourself.

Honestly love this game, its a good way to pass time and to figure out how things combo, its also very cool to see what other people have built, and while you are not directly going head to head with another player you are battling what that player built. It is a very easy system and I very much enjoy it.
Very nice sit back and relax. I like the light puzzle elements of the game (ordering your backpack).
Chance based, Skill adjacent Inventory sorter, what's not to love. Keeps bringing me back for another quick game.

Great game. Deep strategy, compelling decisions, dynamic evolving meta, frequent opportunities to go off-meta, countless builds in dozens of archetypes, frequent balance and content updates.

Play fast and loose, or slow and optimal, fun either way. 

Great game.
This is a really cool game with a good presentation and easy to use.
Great fun for a quick round when you have little time. Matchmaking is fair, and there's a lot of potential for strategy. Definitely recommend.

I love this game. If i'm ever unsure what to play this is what I bring up. Have an hour to spare? lets play a round. honestly it's such a unique game I feel like if you haven't played it you should give it a try. it's also constantly being updated with new items and features. 10/10 would recommend.
Game is very fun and have too much variations...that makes its ver enjoyable.

This game is deceptively deep. The mechanics at work are tons of fun to mess with, and working to put together combos has great payoff. Unironically slept on, but I think the art style is what puts off a lot of people who would love it otherwise.

Very simple but surprisingly deep. The item combinations and class-specific strategies make this a great little game. I like the inventory management, it gets addictive really quickly. I definitely recommend it.
Innoavtive gameplay idea and has the very addictive "one more round" vibe.
Jut completely different playstyle to most games on the market. Worth even if only to experience the mechanics.
made inventory management the whole game and it's a lot of fun, now i wish the "inventory management" category is filled with games in the same vein

Recommended, unfortunately. ðŸ‘

I downloaded Backpack Battles thinking, â€œHow hard can it be? Itâ€™s literally putting stuff in a bag.â€
Well, apparently my entire adult life has been a lie because this game proved I canâ€™t even organize a virtual backpack without experiencing an existential crisis.

Every match is just me trying to jam one more item into my bag like Iâ€™m packing for a vacation I donâ€™t even want to go on. Place one thing wrong and suddenly the broccoli wonâ€™t buff the sword, the chicken nugget refuses to cooperate, and some guy online absolutely steamrolls me with a build that looks like he just shook his backpack upside down and said, â€œGood enough.â€

And the game has the nerve to make cute little sound effects while Iâ€™m getting clobbered.
â€œBoop!â€â€”there goes my strategy.
â€œDing!â€â€”there goes my pride.

10/10.
Absolutely love it.
Hate that I love it.
Would continue rearranging items like a confused raccoon digging through a trash bag.
Very fun game with nice visuals, I may not be that good at it but that doesn't make it less fun to play

The combination of Puzzle game plus Auto battler just works.
Im 200 hours in and im still discovering new combinations and builds. I cant wait for the new Engineer class.

A fun and relaxed take on the auto-battler genre.

The game is "PvP", but actually you are battling "ghosts" of other people, basically their old builds.

Basically being PvE, it is really chill without pressure. There are no time restraints, you can take as long as you want perfecting your inventory before starting the next battle, you can even save and quit and come back later to the same run.

The music is chill, the graphics are cozy. It truly is a game you can actually relax with and just go play it for a while without having to dedicate "x" amount of time to play.
Funny and fast game with infinity of options
This game offers endless possibilities! It's strategic, and the items are cute and super cool. I highly recommend it!
Fun fights, good mechanics, and just a good time over all a great game
A unique and relaxing autobattler. It has many build variations combined with an addictive gameplay loop.
This has easily been on of my most favorite games i keep coming back to this year. highly recommend if you enjoy replayablity and rouge-lite or rogue-like games

50hrs in demo at release, 50ish hours in game now. its come along way.

best game to play when multitasking or when you have broken spurts of free time. honestly this game is worthy of a single screen and full attention when its available. cant say the same for alot of newer games these days.

visible ranking system, art, music, theory crafting, risk reward run building. its got it all. reminds me of how i felt 100 hours into slay the spire. im ranking up quick but have barely scratched the surface.

ez buy!
genuinely fun game i got it at the beta i may not played as much as i wanted but it sure is fun
I cant explain why this game is so addictive but it is and i dont even like anime
Love just sitting down and playing this game on a whim. very creative game and very easy to pick up and put back down. highly recommend this game.

Very funny and entertaining game. I have over a hundred hours in just the demo. Think of it more as a puzzle game or a roguelike than anything competitive. The game really shines when you try to find wacky and insane combos while playing alongside or against friends.

Love the art style and the gameplay is pretty fun as far as Auto-battlers go. each character feels unique in their own way with different strengths and weaknesses and jesus there so many items and combinations that honestly at first it was a hassle to try and unlock every item but they're pretty good at updating and balancing the game and added a built in recipe system much more intuitive than what was in alpha and launch version and if you like auto-battlers and the visuals of seeing everything in your board light up and shine or if wanna make some busted one shot builds that end fights in 0 seconds you can you just need a little bit of luck

Addicting and casual. 
I love spending time puzzling out optimizations of the layout for the backpack. this game has slowly eaten 50 hours of my time in single matches (which take 20-30 minutes.

pretty impressive honestly. I keep coming back.

the devs are still supporting and adding new items and classes to play as which is a big plus. I always eagerly await their releases and play right when i see them drop just to play around with new combos.

I'm sure there are balance issues but after 50 hours i haven't really felt like it (though i am not in super high ranks)

works great on a steam deck to boot!
amazingly fun game for those who like chill puzzlers which cascading combos.
9/10
I didn't expected that such an old storage mechanic could work as an game, it is a nice casual sidegame.. just don't try to tryhard it.

Backpack Battles is the only game where my organizational skills are tested harder than my patience. I spent 20 minutes arranging items perfectlyâ€¦ and 10 seconds watching an enemy yeet them into chaos. Itâ€™s like playing Tetris, but the blocks fight back. 10/10â€”finally a game that validates my lifelong talent for overpacking

After having played backpack battles for over 30 hours now and with the steam awards coming up, I think now is a good time to review this game. The crafting/inventory management is fun and forces you to rethink and frequently rearrange your entire setup. The different classes getting different items and even bags is fun to play around with and the gameplay overall is good. To conclude if you have the time you should consider playing the game as it is easy to get into.
amazing game in ever way, could use a lil better balancing sometimes after updates but they handle it well for the most part
I don't really like the art but the gameplay is absolutely amazing.

Great Game
positives-
lots of ways to play the game (good diversity of items and synergies)
Ranked mode to feel progress in some way (helps feel the game less repetitive)
Achievements (for thoses of us who 100% games theres a lot to do)
negatives-
uhhh i guess the meta gets stale after a while if you play too much in high rank but they do patches one in a while to fix that
-
Overall great game i would recommend
You have 6 Main classes to choose from and there are another 5-6 Subclasses. Amazing game with a lot of ways to play the game. Love it and reccomend it!

I love this game, always playing this while on a break, wonderful experience, short runs and random builds.
Music and graphics are awful tho.
Also it makes my pc run very slowly.
10/10 will recommend again

Very nice relaxing game.

Complex, as there is ton of items and endless combinations.

Pretty balanced as well.

Recomend to anyone who enjoy tuis type od puzzle games.

Backpack Battles is basically Tetris meets PokÃ©mon, but with way more arguing over where to put a frying pan. I went in thinking I was organizing luggage, came out feeling like a wizard who just invented a dragon-powered blender. 10/10 would lose sleep rearranging potions again

A truly addictive auto-battler, was ahead of most of the genre and innovative.
Always come back to this one, since the day it released in early access, love it.
First game of its kind! Excelent idea and perfect game to sit back and relax!

A unique asynchronous PVP game design. Who could have guessed that inventory management could actually be fun. The game is somewhat addictive for making me always want to do another run and try a different build.

Cute hand drawn art contributes to the overall polished user interface. The continuous support from the developers through the early access period and now into full release is appreciated. It keeps the game from getting to stale.
Amazing Cozy puzzle and strategic game
Very fun game and perfect for quick session when you got time :)
Honestly very fun to play and once you get a feel for it then various builds and such are fairly intuitive. Lots of updates and support plus the ability to make your friends fear you.
So creative, so rich in variety. Always good for a quick round or two. But also very impressive depth and endless combinations and tactics. Very much recommended.

A great game, inspired by games like "The Bazzar" and icons of the autobattle genre.
Some would argue, its inspired by games like Tetris, i see the similarities.
Great pricing for a game that is definitly worth every penny for me. No greedy battlepass, no in-game payments with dubious in-game currencies.

I say it again, im willing to give devs that make great games, more money for there games, than for greedy big companys. This game is everything the bazzar wishes to be.
Yes, "The Bazzar" has more depth, this game has fairness and great gameplay.

10/10 would recomeend everyone, who wants to play a great autobattle game.

Sorry but not sorry, for the little rant against "The Bazzar".

This is an incredibly fun casual game where you can see your items to a to of weird and wondeful things! The point of contention for me is in ranked, as the variability and meta-playing reduces that fun down, but that isn't an unpredictable or unknown thing in games with ranked modes. 
Recommended!

Fun game, great music and art style, immersive, semi addicting innovative gameplay. Have played for many more hours at a cheaper price than most AAA games, and probably had the same amount of, if not more, fun as well. Looking forward to the additional classes and content in future updates.
Perfect for killing time ðŸ˜Š! A fun and clever auto-battler, great for short sessions or when you just want to relax and enjoy
Relaxing and fun to play, easy to understand, fun to try and unlock all the items.

Good and soft game to play and stream to friend, nothing compared to this hit!
Its soooo fun i give it a good 9 out of 10 you can play everytimes in the rankings its better this ways to.
Very good game, got to learn combos for different classes though. After you do that youre good to go

Great little autobattler all about sorting your inventory. Very fun game to sit down and see what you can make out of a run. Not every run is going to be the best, some are going to completely fall flat, and some are going to go so nuts you didn't think it was possible. You could come into this game wanting to be the best at it and get annoyed when you're steamrolled by overly min-maxed opponents in higher ranks or you can come at it realizing that at the end of the day this game just requires a bit of luck and hoping you get the right goods. It's not perfect, but I'll keep playing it cause I enjoy it.
Fun little game! Actually figuring out combos is surprisingly deep.
Truly a game you can play endlessly! Brilliant art style, fun references and simultaneously relaxing and satisfying. Would 100% recommend :)

Well, I love it. People complaining are competitive gamers and would rather not rely on rng for the win. I get it, but when it is in your favour it is glorious. Cant wait for the new archetype to drop. Also, adventurer is cracked.

Can confidently say this is the best async auto-battler that currently exists. The class system offers many unique options without diluting the pool, and even more importantly you actually get enough money each round to make the shop fun. Crafting system isn't perfect but its still the best there is.
The interactions and RNG make for a ridiculous amount of re-playability as I scheme about the next build. Active balance updates have kept things evolving for the year I've played

I really like the mechanics. The fight itself only takes a few seconds and I spend most of my time in the shop, where I can always quit and continue later. Rougelike is also great, I don't have to spend a dozens of hours with the game to unlock new gear. On the downside, climbing the ladder is a bit slow. Good game.
Great chill game with fun rng component and excellent for exercising spatial thinking

As a man who enjoys strategically arranging various items into backpacks of many sizes to maximize the efficient usage of their storage capacities in real life, I find this game to be really enjoyable.
This game is getting loads of free updates and has tons of different strats you can change depending on the items you buy and class's you build. Very fun.
Solid game but the devs really love their aggro builds that just try to kill you before you build anything.
Endless creativity and the short loop makes it a game I pick up when I dont know what to do. Ive had plenty of really janky builds that ended up kinda sorta working and I screenshot for my friends

GOTY EZ.
Backpack Battles scratches so many itches for me in great ways. It's like getting a fat slice of condensed ARPG, w/o the more tedious elements. You'll get your fix for lootgoblin maxing, item chasing, inventory tetris, seeing your busted builds payoff, pvp, economy playing, number crunching, theory crafting, etc.

The large pool of items, classes, potential combos, random start, and sea of various ghost players to fight offers many hours of replayability. The gameplay is also delivered in a convenient drop-in-and-drop-out format, but you'll find yourself not wanting to put it down anyway.

All of this is presented in a fun and visually pleasing aesthetic. You even get rewarded w/ many character cosmetics of your choice, so you can look good while beating the snot out of fellow backpackers. I was pleasantly surprised to learn I could turn my Berserker into a wolfgirl. Now, if we could just get werefox and werewolf looks for the Ranger and Berserker... for, uh... reasons.
Great auto battler and puzzle game. Lots of replayability

Apparently I never left a review for this game...

It's the best "auto battler" I've ever played. The asymetric untimed multiplayer makes this the most casual ranked game I've ever played, while retaining all the skill required to play it.
It's really good, I'm just not a fan of so much inventory management, I prefer the way the Bazaar did it.
Good game for waiting on ques of other games. Its very leisurely and easily addicting.

Backpack Battles is my staple for private games with my friends as well as theorycrafting new builds on my own.  Been playing this game for a good long while and I can confidently say that it's changed multiplayer games for the better.  I don't know if anybody did it first, but the asynchronous gameplay is still highly competitive, but with much lower stress.

This game has inspired many others in the genre and I can securely say that the original is worth a playthrough.  With The Bazaar launching at $40, but getting knocked down to $20, I'm definitely willing to claim that the consistent low price of this game is the reason.

If you like strategy games, buy it.  If you like creative gameplay, buy it.  If you like a shifting metagame, buy it.  If you like PvP, but don't like the time pressures, buy it.  If you like the many games that this little masterpiece inspired, buy this one.

Nominate for Steam Awards 2025.  Revolutionized the autobattler genre.

Probably the most in depth and competitive inventory management and auto battler on the market.

Great fun casually but brutal meta awaits if you try to climb the ladder. You should be able to maintain diamond playing basically anything, but that ain't gonna cut it any higher. Game has a lot of optimization potential in the sense that you can spend way longer than needed trying to get your build 1% better.

Game is pretty RNG heavy, but this can be mitigated by being good  : ^ )
I found the demo of this game intriguing, and the full version even more fun when I bought it eventually! It was recommended to me by a cool person and I'm nominating it for game of the year!
If you like organizing, you like this game.   It's inventory management wars and so much more.

Love coming back to this every so often and digging in to a build. There's always something new to check out. I enjoy finding new recipes and altering my playstyle with each run.  The artwork is cute too!
Gra uczÄ…ca zarzÄ…dzania przestrzeniÄ… lepiej niÅ¼ 12 lat szkoÅ‚y
Great pvp autobattler with an art style that reminds me of OG neopets for some reason.
Dobrze Å¼e zaczÄ™li dodawaÄ‡ nowe itemy bo kaÅ¼da bitwa z warzywnÄ… saÅ‚atkÄ… byÅ‚a trochÄ™ nudna :p
I absolutely love this game with friends, that's all to be said.
Awesome game. All about strategy, you have to think about everything you do. 10/10 PLAY IT
Surprisingly deep game that you can play at whatever pace you want.

The "deck" building in Backpack Battles is very unique. I love the skins, though I do wish that I could simply click on the main icon for the outfit and buy the whole thing. The new class coming next year looks so cool and I can't wait for the robot dog!
add a crack berserker and pyromancer feature pls, thanks
I backpack, I battle, I get out min-max'd
Chill and fun brain teaser to sped time on! 13 hours inn and will continue playing.
Very fun relaxing inventory game that I love to play during my downtime!
Just a casual game to relax at the end of the day.
Good game, any gameplay shows exactly what you'll get
Good game! Need more bags.. Never enough bags..
If you like auto battler game like "The Bazaar", you probably will like this more.
This is a fun quick game you can save and come back to
Waiting for more recipes, nice game

negative.review:
Bloatpack battles. The devs kept adding more stuff, diluting the item pool, and didn't bother properly balancing what was already there. Have fun playing against the same builds on anything above diamond.

Really saddens me to see the state of this game and give it a negative review.

I enjoyed the 2 matches i played, but it seems there is no permanent progression of any kind which is really odd. It has cosmetics and a leaderboard, but you start out with all classes and all items unlocked from the beginning. It seems like it would be really easy to lock some items and all but the starter class, to make it feel meaningful to play instead of being a trophy grind with a few useless cosmetics. I really just dont see myself putting any more time into this until there is some reward other than getting a better leaderboard position.

The worst RNG i've ever seen.  Forget trying to make a build.  You have to make the what RNG says.  Half the time you can't find bags to put your items in and end up with multiple item in storage or you skip over important key items because RNG is so bad.  RNG more bad and than good on average for me.  Game could be so good if you had more control over making build you want to try but if you try to do a build good luck because you wont find the things you want unless you play 10 games in a row trying.  Can't recommend a luck based game like this.
mid game

Game is fun in theory but the enjoyment ends when you realize that when playing ranked at higher trophy level runs you will always encounter cheat builds that were achieved using unlimited shop rolls.  Seeing these builds at a glance it's instantly obvious that these item combinations are statistically near-impossible to achieve legitimately, but they bypass detection because the player is using the "correct" amount of gold in their bag despite being able to continue rolling until they found the exact items they wanted.  

Example of a fake build:  Ranger with Hammer build, just so happened to acquire 4 Strong Heroic potions, 4 Lucky Pigs buffing Hammer, 4 Spectral Daggers -- All being buffed by a Hero Longsword, Mega Clover with exact amount of Clovers packing bag for instant buffs, extra Mana Orbs & Snowballs to fill in the gaps, and of course the kicker to prove it's fake -- The treasure item Pumpkin (1 out of 23 treasures) which provides Stun to synergize perfectly with the build.

Some might say "get good" or "those builds just were lucky and had good economy", but understanding the breadth of the item roll pool, how often certain rarities appear, the likelihood of finding the right items at the early/mid/late rounds, makes it clear that these are most likely 1 in 1 million builds that weren't acquired legitimately.

Will no longer be playing this game unless Devs properly address the issue.

Game is mid, too many trash synergies that get absolutely eclipsed by the more op options. This game also reeks of Algorithmic rigging that other games in this genre suffer from, much like Super Auto Pets. Things like, getting matched against players who have a deeper round count than you, meaning they have been through the shop more times than you have so they by default beat you via access to more items and this can happen as early as round 1. The game is only okay but the rigging sucks a lot of the fun out of the game.

Bloatpack battles. The devs kept adding more stuff, diluting the item pool, and didn't bother properly balancing what was already there. Have fun playing against the same builds on anything above diamond.

Really saddens me to see the state of this game and give it a negative review.

I enjoyed the 2 matches i played, but it seems there is no permanent progression of any kind which is really odd. It has cosmetics and a leaderboard, but you start out with all classes and all items unlocked from the beginning. It seems like it would be really easy to lock some items and all but the starter class, to make it feel meaningful to play instead of being a trophy grind with a few useless cosmetics. I really just dont see myself putting any more time into this until there is some reward other than getting a better leaderboard position.

The worst RNG i've ever seen.  Forget trying to make a build.  You have to make the what RNG says.  Half the time you can't find bags to put your items in and end up with multiple item in storage or you skip over important key items because RNG is so bad.  RNG more bad and than good on average for me.  Game could be so good if you had more control over making build you want to try but if you try to do a build good luck because you wont find the things you want unless you play 10 games in a row trying.  Can't recommend a luck based game like this.
Not a newbie friendly games, you should follow meta/builds from the others and got lucky to win.

Seeing these builds at a glance it's instantly obvious that these item combinations are statistically near-impossible to achieve legitimately, but they bypass detection because the player is using the "correct" amount of gold in their bag despite being able to continue rolling until they found the exact items they wanted.  

Example of a fake build:  Ranger with Hammer build, just so happened to acquire 4 Strong Heroic potions, 4 Lucky Pigs buffing Hammer, 4 Spectral Daggers -- All being buffed by a Hero Longsword, Mega Clover with exact amount of Clovers packing bag for instant buffs, extra Mana Orbs & Snowballs to fill in the gaps, and of course the kicker to prove it's fake -- The treasure item Pumpkin (1 out of 23 treasures) which provides Stun to synergize perfectly with the build.

Some might say "get good" or "those builds just were lucky and had good economy", but understanding the breadth of the item roll pool, how often certain rarities appear, the likelihood of finding the right items at the early/mid/late rounds, makes it clear that these are most likely 1 in 1 million builds that weren't acquired legitimately.

Will no longer be playing this game unless Devs properly address the issue.

Game is mid, too many trash synergies that get absolutely eclipsed by the more op options. This game also reeks of Algorithmic rigging that other games in this genre suffer from, much like Super Auto Pets. Things like, getting matched against players who have a deeper round count than you, meaning they have been through the shop more times than you have so they by default beat you via access to more items and this can happen as early as round 1. The game is only okay but the rigging sucks a lot of the fun out of the game.

Bloatpack battles. The devs kept adding more stuff, diluting the item pool, and didn't bother properly balancing what was already there. Have fun playing against the same builds on anything above diamond.

Really saddens me to see the state of this game and give it a negative review.

I enjoyed the 2 matches i played, but it seems there is no permanent progression of any kind which is really odd. It has cosmetics and a leaderboard, but you start out with all classes and all items unlocked from the beginning. It seems like it would be really easy to lock some items and all but the starter class, to make it feel meaningful to play instead of being a trophy grind with a few useless cosmetics. I really just dont see myself putting any more time into this until there is some reward other than getting a better leaderboard position.

The worst RNG i've ever seen.  Forget trying to make a build.  You have to make the what RNG says.  Half the time you can't find bags to put your items in and end up with multiple item in storage or you skip over important key items because RNG is so bad.  RNG more bad and than good on average for me.  Game could be so good if you had more control over making build you want to try but if you try to do a build good luck because you wont find the things you want unless you play 10 games in a row trying.  Can't recommend a luck based game like this.
Not a newbie friendly games, you should follow meta/builds from the others and got lucky to win.
mid game
